column10: Vehicle Collision or Pedestrian Struck (with Injury)

column13:
1.Absolute Peak at 6 PM (691 cases)
→ Highest single-hour crime concentration — clear critical deployment window.

2.Sharp Jump from 3 PM (448) to 5 PM (641)
→ Rapid escalation in just 2 hours — transition from work hours to evening risk.

3.Lowest Point at 5 AM (126 cases)
→ Clear trough before morning activity begins.

4.Vehicle Theft & Theft from Vehicle dominate evening spike
→ Evening peak is largely vehicle-related, not evenly distributed across crimes.

5.Midday (11 AM–1 PM) remains moderately high (~295–445)
→ Crime does not only peak at night; daytime activity is also significant.
